abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome was satisfactory,
            sustainability is likely, with modest institutional
            development impacts. Lessons address: 1) Project design, to
            be limited, and realistic, to clearly define development
            objectives. Performance indicators should be identified to
            clarify the linkages between objectives, and interventions,
            and, the design of the project, and its institutional
            implementation arrangements be carefully adapted to the
            specific institutional capacity, and overall institutional
            environment. 2) Adaptability in project implementation, to
            allow flexible adjustment during project implementation in
            accordance with changing circumstances and needs. 3)
            Institutional arrangements, particularly the right use of a
            project implementation unit (PIU), as a means to solve
            weaknesses in the executing agency, through explicit
            assessment of institutional tradeoffs, and risks, at the
            outset, clearly defining collaborative arrangements between
            the line agency, and the PIU. 4) Community participation,
            which despite not being anticipated in this project design,
            it evolved naturally during implementation, and became most
            effective during supervision, through active collaboration
            among the local community, parents, and teachers. 5)
            Communication strategy, is highlighted as a needed tool
            within this project, for although active participation was
            evident, the communication strategy could have enhanced a
            steady flow of information to stakeholders.
